channel.title: Fixing Bluurr's 'BACKHMID1 0'
channel.description:
Well this has always bugged the shit out of me on Bluurr clients, so I fixed it and now I'm going to show you how.
Since I don't have the crappy gameframe anymore, I can't show you a before & after, but if someone could post the old pic, that would be gladly appreciated.
So it's pretty simple, just replace the image called '[b]BACKHMID1 0[/b]' located in '[b]Files/Spirts/[/b]' and replace it with this: [IMG]http://i46.tinypic.com/9huaab.png[/img]
Enjoy your non-messed up gameframe.
